intro: Cicerbita neglecta, commonly known as the common celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Popiaceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in clusters. Cicerbita neglecta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
